solution.text:
Given pair of equations are:
_{i}_x + ky = _{{7*i}}_ and _{j}_x + _{i}_y = l.
_{i}_x + ky - _{{7*i}}_ = 0 -------(1)
_{j}_x + _{i}_y - l = 0 -------(2)
Comparing with general equations, we get:
\(a_1 = _{i}_ ,a_2 = _{j}_ ,b_1 = k ,b_2 = _{i}_ ,c_1 = -_{{7*i}}_, c_2 = -l\)
For no solution following is the criteria:
i.e., \({a_1\over a_2} = {b_1\over b_2} = {c_1\over c_2}\)
i.e., \({_{i}_\over _{j}_} = {k\over _{i}_} = {_{{7*i}}_\over l}\)
i.e., \({_{i}_\over _{j}_} = {k\over _{i}_}\), \({_{i}_\over _{j}_} = {_{{7*i}}_\over l}\)
i.e., \(k = {_{{i*i}}_\over _{j}_}\), l = _{{7*j}}_

content.text:
Find the value of k and l for which following pair of equation has infinitely many solutions.
_{i}_x + ky = _{{7*i}}_ and _{j}_x + _{i}_y = l.
